question_sentence: Twitter confirmed the company will be sold to Elon Musk for approximately how much?
As part of his first grants of clemency, President Biden pardoned how many people?
The star-laden Brooklyn Nets were swept out of the playoffs by the Boston Celtics. The Nets lost their four games by a combined:
After the winter surge of omicron, the CDC found that what percentage of American adults have been infected by the coronavirus?
Which of these actors posted their “last tweet” after it was announced Elon Musk would purchase Twitter?
A man set a new Guinness World record by stacking how many M&Ms?
The FAA opened an investigation after a stunt involving two airplanes and two pilots went wrong. What were the pilots attempting?
A woman was tackled after running onto the basketball court during a game between the Grizzlies and Timberwolves. Why'd she do that?
choices: She didn't agree with a call
She found a bug under her chair
She wanted to hug a player

question_sentence: World leaders, friends and family gathered to celebrate the life of Madeleine Albright. She was the nation's first female:
Kane Tanaka, who was the world's oldest person, died this week in Japan. How old was she?
The right-wing leader of which European country was voted out of office on the same day of Emmanuel Macron’s election victory over Marine Le Pen?
evidence: Slovenia’s populist PM Janez Jansa (pictured) lost to left-leaning newcomer Robert Golob in a national election on 24 April as France’s far-right leader Le Pen was also defeated at the polls. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast

question_sentence: Prince Andrew was stripped of which honorary title this week after a unanimous vote?
choices: Freedom of the City of London
Freedom of the City of York
Freedom of the City of Belfast
Freedom of the City of Canterbury
evidence: City of York Council members backed a motion to remove the honour in a unanimous vote. The councillors also called for Andrew to relinquish his Duke of York title in the wake of his out-of-court settlement with Virginia Roberts Giuffre

question_sentence: A total of at least how many MPs have reportedly been referred  to a parliamentary watchdog over sexual misconduct allegations?
evidence: The Independent Complaints and Grievance Scheme (ICGS) has reportedly received more than 70 complaints about MPs that range from making sexually inappropriate comments to more serious wrongdoing

question_sentence: A sudden recent spike in what illness in children has been linked to lockdowns and social distancing?
evidence: Around 190 severe cases of the liver disease had been reported in children worldwide as of last week. Experts suggested that the global outbreak may be linked to lowered immunity due to lack of exposure to viruses during Covid lockdowns

question_sentence: According to new research, getting onto the property ladder takes women an average of how much longer than their male counterparts?
evidence: Property platform Boomin found that the average British male requires 7.3 times their annual salary to cover the current average property price of £278,120, while the average British female needs to find 11.1 times her average annual income

question_sentence: Who did Piers Morgan interview for the launch of Rupert Murdoch’s new television channel TalkTV?
evidence: The Independent’s Holly Baxter described the interview as the ‘most toe-curlingly embarrassing TV you’ll ever see in your life’. The new channel is widely viewed as a rival to right-wing start-up GB News

question_sentence: Which former New Labour star is rumoured to be under pressure from party figures to return to the Commons?
evidence: Labour figures reportedly believe Balls could bring  the “big beast factor” if he were to stand for Labour in the forthcoming Wakefield by-election

question_sentence: A nationwide shortage of what pharmaceutical product has had campaigners complaining of ‘medical sexism’?
evidence: Covid-related ingredient supply problems have been blamed for the acute HRT shortages in recent weeks. In response, health secretary Sajid Javid has said he will appoint a new HRT ‘tsar’ to oversee supply demand

question_sentence: What percentage of UK homes are subjected to air pollution levels above World Health Organization guidelines, according to an Imperial College London study?
evidence: In Slough, a record 90% of homes were in the top 10% most polluted, followed by London, with 66%. Other cities most affected include Portsmouth, Leeds and Manchester

question_sentence: How many Russian troops are estimated to have been killed during the invasion of Ukraine, according to British intelligence?
evidence: The figure means that Russia has lost more troops in 61 days of fighting in Ukraine than the US and its allies lost during 20 years of conflict in Afghanistan and Iraq

question_sentence: Which high-level US official traveled to Ukraine this week?
evidence: Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin traveled to the Ukrainian capital of Kyiv, where they met with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky, making them the highest-level US officials to have traveled to the country since the Russian invasion began in late February. While there, Blinken announced that US diplomats will return to Ukraine.

question_sentence: Twitter agreed to be bought by Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk this week. How much is the deal worth?
evidence: Twitter announced it will sell itself to Musk in a roughly $44 billion deal – putting the world’s richest man in charge of one of the world’s most influential social networks.

question_sentence: Who won France’s presidential election in a runoff this week?
evidence: Emmanuel Macron won France’s presidential election, fending off a historic challenge from far-right candidate Marine Le Pen during a runoff vote on Sunday. This makes President Macron the first French leader to be reelected in 20 years.

question_sentence: A federal judge temporarily blocked the Biden administration from lifting a Trump-era pandemic restriction on the US-Mexico border this week. Which state does the judge represent?
evidence: Judge Robert Summerhays of Louisiana temporarily blocked the Biden administration from ending Title 42, a border policy that allows authorities to turn migrants back to Mexico or their home countries citing pandemic concerns.

question_sentence: China is battling its biggest Covid-19 wave yet. Which large city there implemented mass coronavirus testing this week?
evidence: Beijing has rolled out mass Covid-19 testing for nearly 20 million residents in most of the city as authorities race to contain a fresh Omicron outbreak that has sparked panic buying amid fears of a Shanghai-style lockdown.

question_sentence: Kane Tanaka, the world’s oldest person, passed away this week. How old was she?
evidence: Kane Tanaka died in Japan at age 119. Born in 1903, Tanaka married a rice shop owner at the age of 19 and worked in the family store until she was 103. She twice survived cancer and lived through a multitude of historical events, surviving two world wars and the 1918 Spanish flu – as well as the Covid-19 pandemic.

question_sentence: Why did Russia cut off gas supplies to Poland and Bulgaria this week?
choices: The two countries refused to pay in rubles
The two countries do not need Russia’s gas supplies
Russia wants to sell all its gas to China
evidence: Russia halted gas supplies in Poland and Bulgaria after they refused to meet a demand by Moscow to pay in rubles, rather than euros or dollars.

question_sentence: Bitcoin may be a new investment option in your 401(k) plan this year. Which company will become the first major 401(k) provider to offer cryptocurrency as an investment for retirement savers?
evidence: Fidelity Investments – the largest 401(k) plan provider in the US with more than 20 million participants – will become the first major 401(k) provider to offer cryptocurrency as a retirement investment option. But if you’re interested, you’ll have to check with your employer first, because the bitcoin option will only be offered to participants whose employers have elected to include it in their plans.

question_sentence: Which state’s governor passed legislation this week that bans nonbinary gender markers on birth certificates?
evidence: Oklahoma Republican Gov. Kevin Stitt signed a law Tuesday that states the biological sex designation on birth certificate must be either male or female and shall not be nonbinary or any symbol representing a nonbinary designation.

question_sentence: Which rare item sold at an auction for $57.5 million this week?
evidence: The world’s largest blue diamond ever to come to auction has sold for $57.5 million. The winning bid, which surpassed its high estimate of $48 million, came from an anonymous buyer by telephone.
